Components

Canon UI Components built with React

  • Buttons
  • Button Groups
  • Progress Bars
components
Buttons

Canon offers a variety of different buttons. They are implemented with the Button component.

Properties

  • onClick
  • enabled
  • hidden
  • type
onClick

onClick takes the function that will be executed when the button is clicked.

Example

Component Source 
<Button onClick="{alert('Hi'!')}">Button</Button>
enabled

enabled takes a boolean value (true by default) that toggles whether or not the button is disabled. When enabled is false the onClick function will not be executed.

Example

Component Source 
<Button onClick="{alert('Hi'!')}">Enabled</Button>
 
<Button onClick="{alert('Hi'!')}" enabled="{false}">Disabled</Button>
hidden

hidden takes a boolean value (false by default) that toggles whether or not the button is visible.

Example

Component Source 
<Button onClick="{alert('Hi'!')}">Visible</Button>
 
<Button onClick="{alert('Hi'!')}" hidden="{true}">Hidden</Button>
type

type takes a string value ('secondary' by default) that controls the look and feel of the button. The following types are supported:

  • 'primary'
  • 'secondary'
  • 'link'
  • 'login'
  • 'cog'
  • 'delete'
  • 'edit'
  • 'plus'

Example

Component Source 
<Button onClick="{alert('Hi'!')}" type="primary">Primary</Button>
 
<Button onClick="{alert('Hi'!')}" type="secondary">Secondary</Button>
 
<Button onClick="{alert('Hi'!')}" type="link">Link</Button>
 
<Button onClick="{alert('Hi'!')}" type="login">Login</Button>
 
<Button onClick="{alert('Hi'!')}" type="cog">Cog</Button>
 
<Button onClick="{alert('Hi'!')}" type="delete">Delete</Button>
 
<Button onClick="{alert('Hi'!')}" type="edit">Edit</Button>
 
<Button onClick="{alert('Hi'!')}" type="plus">Plus</Button>
components
Button Groups

Button Groups are used to lay out a set of related buttons. Button groups have two different states: normal and submitting

Normal

In a normal state the buttons are active and ready for interaction from the user. The ProcessingIndicator is either hidden (by default) or not rendered.

Example

Source


<ButtonGroup>
  <Button type="primary">Primary</Button>
  <Button type="secondary">Secondary</Button>
  <Button type="link">Cancel</Button>
  <ProcessingIndicator hidden="{true}"/>
</ButtonGroup>

Submitting

In a submitting state an action is being processed and the buttons are disabled. The ProcessingIndicator is rendered with a property of hidden: false. Cancel links are also hidden with this pattern.

Example

Source


<ButtonGroup>
  <Button type="primary" enabled="{false}">Primary</Button>
  <Button type="secondary" enabled="{false}">Secondary</Button>
  <Button type="link" hidden="{true}">Cancel</Button>
  <ProcessingIndicator hidden="{false}"/>
</ButtonGroup>
components
Progress Bars

Progress Bars can be used to indicate both progress and state.

Properties

  • progress
  • status
  • type
  • size
progress

progress takes a number between 0 and 100 that specifies the percentage of the data being represented.

Example

Component Source 
<ProgressBar progress="60" />
status

status takes a string (info is the default) that specifies the state of the action that is in progress. Allowed Types are:

  • ok
  • error
  • warning
  • info

Example

Component Source 
<ProgressBar progress="60" status="ok" />
 
<ProgressBar progress="60" status="error" />
 
<ProgressBar progress="60" status="warning" />
 
<ProgressBar progress="60" status="info" />
type

type takes a string (solid is the default). This is used to indicate additional information about work being done. The allowed types are:

  • solid
  • striped

Example

Component Source 
<ProgressBar progress="60" type="solid" />
 
<ProgressBar progress="60" type="striped" />
size

Progress bars can be given a fixed width with the size property. The allowed sizes are:

  • xsmall
  • small
  • medium
  • large
  • xlarge

Example

Component Source 
<ProgressBar progress="60" size="xsmall" />
 
<ProgressBar progress="60" size="small" />
 
<ProgressBar progress="60" size="medium" />
 
<ProgressBar progress="60" size="large" />
 
<ProgressBar progress="60" size="xlarge" />
